Aurora.Framework.RegistryCore Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for Aurora.Framework.RegistryCore:

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

void AddModuleInterfaces (Dictionary< Type, List< object >> dictionary)
 Add more than one module interface. This is usually used to copy the contents of one registry core into another.
Dictionary< Type, List< object > > GetInterfaces ()
 Get all the modules in the registry.
void RegisterModuleInterface< T > (T mod)
 Register an interface to a region module. This allows module methods to be called directly as well as via events. If there is already a module registered for this interface, it is not replaced (is this the best behaviour?).
void RemoveAllInterfaces ()
 Removes all interfaces from the registry.
T RequestModuleInterface< T > ()
 For the given interface, retrieve the region module which implements it.
T[] RequestModuleInterfaces< T > ()
 For the given interface, retrieve an array of region modules that implement it.
void StackModuleInterface< T > (T mod)
 Add more than one module to the same interface in the registry.
bool TryRequestModuleInterface< T > (out T iface)
 Try to get a module from the interface by type. Returns false if it could not find a module.
void UnregisterModuleInterface< T > (T mod)
 Remove a module from the registry.

Register an interface to a region module. This allows module methods to be called directly as well as via events. If there is already a module registered for this interface, it is not replaced (is this the best behaviour?).

T [] Aurora.Framework.RegistryCore.RequestModuleInterfaces< T > (  ) 

For the given interface, retrieve an array of region modules that implement it.

Returns:
an empty array if there are no registered modules implementing that interface
